title: Soccer: Peru beat Iceland 3-1 in friendly
text:
March 28, 2018 / 3:04 AM / in 13 hours Soccer: Peru beat Iceland 3-1 in friendly Reuters Staff 2 Min Read 
(Reuters) - Peru scored their second victory over a European side in less than a week on Tuesday after a strong second-half performance helped them to a 3-1 win over Iceland in a friendly match in New Jersey. Mar 27, 2018; Harrison, NJ, USA; Peru defender Luis Advincula (17) battles Iceland midfielder Rurik Gislason (19) for the ball during an international friendly men's soccer match at Red Bull Arena. Noah K. Murray-USA TODAY Sports 
The game was only two minutes old when poor defending from Iceland allowed Renato Tapia a free header from six yards out. 
Iceland equalized midway through the first half when Jon Guoni Fjoluson headed home a corner from close range. 
Peru took the lead again 12 minutes into the second half when Raul Ruidiaz slotted home from a tight angle before Jefferson Farfan got the third when his shot from 12 yards out took a deflection that wrongfooted the goalkeeper and trundled home. Slideshow (3 Images) 
The victory came four days after Peru beat Croatia 2-0 in Miami. 
Peru are heading to their first World Cup in 36 years this summer and will face Denmark, France and Australia in Group C. 
Iceland, who are preparing for their first appearance at the finals, begin their Group D campaign against Argentina on June 16 before playing Nigeria and Croatia. Repofrting by Andrew Downie; Editing by Peter Rutherford
